## Introduction to Statistics

* Start with [Chapter 1 - Intro to Data & Chapter 2 - Descriptive Measures](https://bookdown.org/lgpcappiello/introstats/introduction-to-data.html)
* Finish with [Chapter 4 - Probability & Chapter 5 - Random Variables](https://bookdown.org/lgpcappiello/introstats/probability-concepts.html)
  + More with [Probability and Random Variables](https://bookdown.org/speegled/foundations-of-statistics/prob.html)

* [SimpleR - Using R for Introductory Statistics](https://cran.r-project.org/doc/contrib/Verzani-SimpleR.pdf)

  + This "book" has a concise summary of lots of statstical stuff "to do," not really about "what it means."
  
## Visualizing Data

* Start with [Chapter 2 - Visualizing your Data](https://bookdown.org/mikemahoney218/IDEAR/visualizing-your-data.html)

## More about R and this prior stuff

* peruse [Foundations of Statistics with R](https://bookdown.org/speegled/foundations-of-statistics/)

## R and Statistics

Lots of good sources, my personal favorites include:

* [Geeks For Geeks R-Statistics](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/r-statistics/)
* [Guru99 R Tutorial for Beginners: Learn R Programming Language](https://www.guru99.com/r-tutorial.html)
* [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/)
* [R Graphics Cookbook, 2e](https://r-graphics.org/)
